engagements.onPost: AI Impact on Enterprise SaaS thread
engagements.theirComment: The switching costs that justified SaaS valuations for a decade are collapsing. The scary part isn't the layoffs—it's that most of these companies have no real moat beyond user habits.
engagements.ourReply: Exactly. The 'stickiness = moat' thesis that drove SaaS to 20x revenue multiples is being stress-tested in real time. The companies surviving aren't the ones with the most lock-in — they're the ones building AI that creates NEW switching costs. ServiceNow's agentic platform is a good example.

engagements.onPost: AI Impact on Enterprise SaaS thread
engagements.theirComment: Moats beyond habit are crumbling, the real work begins
engagements.ourReply: 100%. The companies that figure out how to build AI-native value chains — not just AI features bolted onto legacy products — will define the next decade of enterprise software. Watch $CRM and $WDAY earnings in the next 2 weeks.

engagements.theirComment: What's the Deepseek update? May be I missed it.
engagements.ourReply: DeepSeek just expanded their flagship model with a 10x context window boost and more current training data — widely seen as a pre-release teaser before Chinese New Year (Feb 15). Reuters reported today that DeepSeek + several other Chinese labs are expected to drop major model updates around the holiday.
engagements.note: 23+ year tech veteran (Meta, Amex, Cadence) — good connection to build
